definition: to be more of a hindrance than a help
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush

sentences.english: Because, slowly but surely, you are doing your gender a disservice.
sentences.chinese: 因为慢慢你会发现你无疑在给你的男性魅力帮倒忙。

sentences.english: Don't speak, you will do a disservice to him.
sentences.chinese: 不要再说了，你只会给他帮倒忙。

sentences.english: When they do help with the work, it isn't good.
sentences.chinese: 当他们试图帮忙的时候，总会帮倒忙。

sentences.english: Job seekers do themselves a disservice when they send out résumés with more information than they need.
sentences.chinese: 求职者在简历中包含过量的信息是在给自己帮倒忙。

sentences.english: Low Calorie diet plans are simply counter-productive.
sentences.chinese: 低卡路里饮食是典型的帮倒忙。

definition: to be officious/to kibitz/to be meddlesome/to force one's help upon
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to be a drag or hindrance on sb
to make a mess of sth
to help out
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
clumsy/all thumbs
to pour oil on the fire (idiom); fig. to aggravate a situation/to enrage people and make matters worse
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
(theater) to dismantle the stage/(fig.) to pull the rug out from under sb's feet/to undermine sb's plans
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
meddling in other people's business
to back sb up/to support sb in an argument/(lit. to beat nearby drum)
